intro: Hypoestes australiensis, commonly known as the Australian pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Hypoestes australiensis is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions of Australia.
